item.title: Yell Help
item.dc:creator: @PlucScape PlucScape
item.description:
@PlucScape wrote:

I don’t have the knowledge to answer you the best you could get at. But let me tell you this-
If you have a sensor on your normal chat, you can just copy+paste part of the code so you would make it in yell…

In .net, the code would look something like this:
if my.text = (* & “word” & ) then
my.text = ( & “****” & *)

If you get to see what I mean, it could maybe translated into java.
Good luck

Read full topic

item.title: Yell Help
item.dc:creator: @I_Hope_I I Hope I
item.description:
@I_Hope_I wrote:

How can I make it so some words cannot be used on my yell ?
Here’s my code:

[code]if (command.startsWith(“yell”) && command.length() > 5 && playerRights >= 0 && !muted) {

            String titles = "";
            
            if (playerRights == 1) {
                titles = "[@cya@Moderator@bla@] ";
            }
            if (playerRights == 2) {
                titles = "[@blu@Admin@bla@] ";
            }
            if (playerRights == 3) {
                titles = "@yel@[Owner] ";
            }                
            if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("i")) {
                titles = "[@yel@Co-Owner@bla@] ";
            }              
            if (playerRights == 4) {
                titles = "[Player] ";
            }
            if (playerRights == 0 && donator == 1) {
                titles = "[@red@Donator@bla@] ";
            }
	if (playerRights == 0 && donator == 0) {
                titles = "[Player] ";
            }                
            talk(titles + "" + playerName + ": "
                    + command.substring(5));

}
[/code]

Thanks

Read full topic
